subdisciplines.name: Structural engineering
subdisciplines.description: The analysis and design of structures that support or resist loads.

subdisciplines.name: Geotechnical engineering
subdisciplines.description: The study of the behavior and properties of soil and rock, and their interactions with structures.

subdisciplines.name: Transportation engineering
subdisciplines.description: The planning, design, operation, and maintenance of transportation systems, including highways, railways, and airports.

subdisciplines.name: Water resources engineering
subdisciplines.description: The study of the management of water resources, including water supply, irrigation, flood control, and environmental protection.

subdisciplines.name: Construction engineering and management
subdisciplines.description: The planning, design, and management of construction projects, including scheduling, budgeting, and risk management.

subdisciplines.name: Geoengineering
subdisciplines.description: The study and modification of the Earth's environment using engineering principles.

subdisciplines.name: Structural Engineering
subdisciplines.description: The design and analysis of structures that support or resist loads, such as buildings, bridges, or tunnels.

subdisciplines.name: Transportation Engineering
subdisciplines.description: The planning, design, and operation of transportation systems, including roads, bridges, airports, and public transit.

subdisciplines.name: Water Resources Engineering
subdisciplines.description: The management of water resources, such as rivers, lakes, and groundwater, for human use and environmental protection.
